verbs.description: underpin (third-person singular simple present underpins, present participle underpinning, simple past and past participle underpinned)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To support from below with props or masonry.
examples: You should underpin the mine roof to prevent further collapse.

entries.meaning: (transitive, figuratively) To give support to; to corroborate.
examples: Public confidence in politicians must underpin our democracy.
